vstore.framework.node

Class NodeManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • vstore.framework.node.NodeManager

  • public class NodeManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for managing information about the storage nodes for the vStore framework. The storage node list is currently just a hard-coded list of nodes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  NodeManager.Mode
      The modes in this enumeration specify, how a node should be determined.

      • refreshNodes

        public void refreshNodes()
        Refreshes the node list by reading all nodes from the database.

      • downloadNodeInfoFromMaster

        public java.util.List<NodeInfo> downloadNodeInfoFromMaster(boolean block)
        Downloads only the storage node information from the master node.
        Parameters:
        block - Set this to true, if the download should block. Set this to false, if it should not block. In the latter case, this function will return null since the result is not known yet. Will also return null in case an error occurred.
        Returns:
        If the block-parameter is true, a list of the retrieved NodeInfos will be returned. Null in other cases, since the task is running in the background.

      • addNode

        public NodeInfo addNode(NodeInfo n)
        Adds a new storage node to the node manager. Once the connection to the node has been confirmed, and once the node has replied with its UUID and type, it will be persisted to the local framework database. This method will block until the node has replied or will timeout after 5 seconds.
        Parameters:
        n - The NodeInfo of the new storage node to add.
        Returns:
        The final configuration of the node, if the node has replied and was successfully added to the framework. Null, if the node did not reply or if a timeout occurred.

      • getNode

        public NodeInfo getNode(java.lang.String uuid)
        Parameters:
        uuid - Returns the node info for the node with the given UUID
        Returns:
        The node info or null, if node cannot be found.

      • getNodeList

        public final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,NodeInfo> getNodeList()
        Returns:
        A mapping of "Node ID" -- "Node info" containing all nodes currently in the manager.

      • deleteNode

        public void deleteNode(java.lang.String uuid)
        Deletes a node from the node manager and the database.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the node to delete.

      • updateNode

        public void updateNode(NodeInfo n)
        Updates the configuration for the given node and saves it to the database.
        Parameters:
        n - The updated node information

      • clearNodes

        public void clearNodes()
        Deletes all nodes from the node manager and the database.

      • getNodesOfType

        public java.util.List<NodeInfo> getNodesOfType(NodeType type)
        Returns a list with nodes of the given NodeType.
        Parameters:
        type - The NodeType to look for in the nodes list.
        Returns:
        A list of nodes that are of the given NodeType.

      • getNearestNodeOfType

        public NodeInfo getNearestNodeOfType(NodeType type,
                                     VLatLng location)
        Returns the nearest node that is of the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - The NodeType to look for.
        location - Each node is compared against this distance.
        Returns:
        The NodeInfo of the nearest node that is of the given type.

      • get_N_NearestNodesOfType

        public java.util.List<NodeInfo> get_N_NearestNodesOfType(NodeType type,
                                                         VLatLng location,
                                                         int N)
        Gets the N closest nodes according to the limit (or less, if only less are available).
        Parameters:
        type - The node type to get N nearest nodes for.
        location - The location to compare against.
        N - The number of nodes N that should be contained in the result.
        Returns:
        A list containing N or less nodes of the given type that are closest.

      • getNearestNodeOfTypes

        public NodeInfo getNearestNodeOfTypes(NodeType[] types,
                                      VLatLng location,
                                      int randomFactor)
        Returns the nearest node that is of one of the given types. If you specify the third parameter, one is randomly chosen among the n closest ones.
        Parameters:
        types - The array of NodeTypes to look for.
        location - Each node is compared against this distance.
        randomFactor - If this number is greater than 0, we take nodes of the count of this number and randomly select one among those.
        Returns:
        The NodeInfo of the nearest node that is of one of the given types.

      • getFirstNodeOfType

        public NodeInfo getFirstNodeOfType(NodeType type)
        Gets the first node that is in the list that is of the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - The NodeType to look for.
        Returns:
        The NodeInfo describing the node that was found. Or null, if no node of the given type was found.

      • getRandomNodeOfTypes

        public NodeInfo getRandomNodeOfTypes(NodeType[] types)
        Gets a random node from one of the available nodes of the given types.
        Parameters:
        types - The NodeTypes to look for.
        Returns:
        The NodeInfo describing the node that was found. Or null, if no node of the given type was found.

        public NodeInfo getRandomNodeFromList(java.util.List<NodeInfo> nodes)
        Returns a random node from the given list.
        Parameters:
        nodes - The list of nodes.
        Returns:
        A random node information from the given list.

      • getNearestNodeFromList

                                       VLatLng loc)
        Returns the nearest node from the given list
        Parameters:
        nodes - The list of nodes
        loc - The location
        Returns:
        The nearest node information.

      • getRandomNode

        public NodeInfo getRandomNode()
        Gets any random node.
        Returns:
        The NodeInfo describing the node that was found. Or null, if no nodes are available

      • getNodesOfTypes

        public java.util.List<NodeInfo> getNodesOfTypes(NodeType[] types)
        You can specify a list of types and the result will contain all nodes of these types.
        Parameters:
        types - The node types you want to get the nodes for.
        Returns:
        The list of nodes for the given types.

      • getNodeFollowingHierarchy

        public NodeInfo getNodeFollowingHierarchy(java.util.List<NodeType> hierarchy,
                                          NodeManager.Mode mode,
                                          VLatLng location)
        Will go through all nodes of different types following the given hierarchy. If no node of the first level is found, it will search the next node type level of the given hierarchy. E.g. if you specify CLOUDLET and CLOUD, at first it is tried to fetch a node of type CLOUDLET. If none is found, the next level (CLOUD) is checked. If still no node has been found, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        hierarchy - The hierarchy of node types.
        mode - The mode how to select a node from a hierarchy-level, see NodeManager.Mode.
        location - Has to be specified if you set the mode parameter to NodeManager.Mode.NEAREST.
        Returns:
        The NodeInfo of a node if one has been found. Null otherwise.

      • getNodesMatchingBandwidthAndRadius

        public java.util.List<NodeInfo> getNodesMatchingBandwidthAndRadius(NodeType t,
                                                                   float bw_up,
                                                                   float bw_down,
                                                                   float min_radius,
                                                                   float max_radius,
                                                                   VLatLng loc)
        Finds all nodes of the given type that meet the required bandwidth and radius constraints. If you specify min and max radius, only nodes in this area are considered.
        Parameters:
        t - The type of node.
        bw_up - The upstream bandwidth. Set it to 0 to ignore it.
        bw_down - The downstream bandwidth. Set it to 0 to ignore it.
        min_radius - The minimum radius from which to search for matching nodes. Set to 0 to search from here.
        max_radius - The upper radius limit.
        loc - The location around which the radius must match.
        Returns:
        A list of node infos that match the parameters.

      • getRandomNodeOfTypeMatchingBandwidth

        public NodeInfo getRandomNodeOfTypeMatchingBandwidth(NodeType t,
                                                     float bw_up,
                                                     float bw_down,
                                                     float min_radius,
                                                     float max_radius,
                                                     VLatLng loc)
        Finds all nodes of the given type that meet the required bandwidth constraint. If you specify min and max radius, only nodes in this area are considered.
        Parameters:
        t - The type of node.
        bw_up - The upstream bandwidth. Set it to 0 to ignore it.
        bw_down - The downstream bandwidth. Set it to 0 to ignore it.
        min_radius - The minimum radius from which to search for matching nodes. Set to 0 to search from here.
        max_radius - The upper radius limit.
        loc - The location around which the radius must match.
        Returns:
        A node info that matches the parameters.

      • getRandomNodeMatchingBandwidthAndRadius

        public NodeInfo getRandomNodeMatchingBandwidthAndRadius(float bw_up,
                                                        float bw_down,
                                                        float min_radius,
                                                        float max_radius,
                                                        VLatLng loc)
        Finds all nodes that meet the required bandwidth constraint. If you specify radius, max and loc, the radius will be increased continually by 500 meters until a node has been found or max is reached.
        Parameters:
        bw_up - The upstream bandwidth. Set it to 0 to ignore it.
        bw_down - The downstream bandwidth. Set it to 0 to ignore it.
        min_radius - The minimum radius from which to search for matching nodes. Set to 0 to search from here.
        max_radius - The upper radius limit.
        loc - The location around which the radius must match.
        Returns:
        A node info that matches the parameters.

      • getRandomNodeOfTypeWithinRadius

        public NodeInfo getRandomNodeOfTypeWithinRadius(NodeType[] types,
                                                VLatLng loc,
                                                float radius,
                                                float max,
                                                float multiplier,
                                                NodeType fallback)
        Returns a node within the given radius of the given type (if available).
        Parameters:
        types - The node types to apply the search to.
        loc - The location to check against
        radius - The radius in meters.
        max - If set to a higher value than 0, the radius will be increased to deliver a match if the initial radius was to small. Will only be increased until max is reached.
        multiplier - The multiplier for radius (for exponential increase strategy of the radius). Is used for increasing until max or until something is found.
        fallback - If no node has been found after reaching max, a random node of the specified type will be selected from the list regardless of distance.
        Returns:
        NodeInfo if a node is found, or null.

      • getRandomNodeFromListWithinRadius

        public NodeInfo getRandomNodeFromListWithinRadius(java.util.List<NodeInfo> nodes,
                                                  VLatLng loc,
                                                  float radius,
                                                  float max,
                                                  float multiplier,
                                                  NodeType fallback)
        Returns a random node from the list within the given radius.
        Parameters:
        nodes - The list of storage nodes from which to select a node.
        loc - The location to check against
        radius - The radius in meters.
        max - If set to a higher value than 0, the radius will be increased to deliver a match if the initial radius was to small. Will only be increased until max is reached.
        multiplier - The multiplier for radius (for exponential increase strategy of the radius). Is used for increasing until max or until something is found.
        fallback - If no node has been found after reaching max, a random node of the specified type will be selected from the list regardless of distance.
        Returns:
        NodeInfo if a node is found, or null.

      • getNodesByUploadTime

        public java.util.List<NodeInfo> getNodesByUploadTime(NodeType t,
                                                     long filesize,
                                                     int seconds)
        Finds all nodes of the given type that match the required upload time for the given file size.
        Parameters:
        t - The Node type
        filesize - The file size in bytes that needs to be uploaded
        seconds - The maximum upload duration
        Returns:
        A list containing all nodes of the type that match the constraints.

      • getAllNodesByUploadTime

        public java.util.List<NodeInfo> getAllNodesByUploadTime(long filesize,
                                                        int seconds)
        Finds all nodes that match the required upload time for the given file size.
        Parameters:
        filesize - The file size in bytes that needs to be uploaded
        seconds - The maximum upload duration
        Returns:
        A list containing all nodes that match the constraints.

      • getRandomNodeOfTypeFromList

        public NodeInfo getRandomNodeOfTypeFromList(java.util.List<NodeInfo> nodes,
                                            NodeType t)
        Gets a random node from the list that is of the given type.
        Parameters:
        nodes - The list of nodes (can contain any type, only the relevant type will be used)
        t - The type
        Returns:
        The node info.
